data.question: What are the two polymorphs of Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 identified in the study?
data.answer: The two polymorphs identified are one green (1) and one blue (2).

data.question: How do the coordination geometries of Cu(II) centers differ between the green and blue polymorphs of Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2?
data.answer: In the green polymorph (1), Cu(II) centers have a five-coordinate geometry, while in the blue polymorph (2), Cu(II) centers have a six-coordinate geometry.

data.question: What property is exhibited by both polymorphs of Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 upon exposure to volatile organic compounds?
data.answer: Both polymorphs exhibit vapochromic properties upon exposure to volatile organic compounds.

data.question: What happens to the Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 polymorphs when they are exposed to ambient water vapor at room temperature?
data.answer: When exposed to ambient water vapor at room temperature, both polymorphs convert to the same Cu[Au(CN)2]2(H2O)2 complex.

data.question: What is the role of [Au(CN)2]- units in the vapochromic behavior of Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 polymorphs?
data.answer: The [Au(CN)2]- units provide a sensitive CN reporter group for IR identification of the adsorbed solvent and contribute to the structural dimensionality and stabilization of the flexible framework.

data.question: True or False: The green polymorph (1) of Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 is the thermodynamic product, while the blue polymorph (2) is likely a kinetic product.
data.answer: True

data.question: What structural feature allows the Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 system to adapt and bind different donor solvent molecules?
data.answer: The flexible coordination sphere of Cu(II), facilitated by Jahn−Teller distortions and the lability of Cu(II), allows the system to adapt and bind different donor solvent molecules.

data.question: True or False: The vapochromic behavior of Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 polymorphs is due to changes in the crystal field splitting as different donor solvent molecules bind to the Cu(II) center.
data.answer: True

data.question: How does the IR spectrum of Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 polymorphs change upon solvent exchange?
data.answer: The IR spectrum changes in the νCN region, with shifts varying between 10 and 40 cm-1 and changes in the number of bands, depending on the solvent exchanged.

data.question: True or False: The Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 system is significantly luminescent.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the effect of thermal treatment on the solvent-free complex Cu[Au(CN)2]2?
data.answer: Thermal treatment removes water molecules from Cu[Au(CN)2]2(H2O)2, leading to some rearrangement in the framework of the solvent-free complex Cu[Au(CN)2]2.

data.question: True or False: The thermal stabilities of the two polymorphs of Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 with respect to the loss of the first DMSO molecules are significantly different.
data.answer: True

data.question: What happens when DMSO vapor is added back to Cu[Au(CN)2]2(H2O)2?
data.answer: When DMSO vapor is added back to Cu[Au(CN)2]2(H2O)2, it converts exclusively to the green polymorph Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 (1), even if the original complex was the blue polymorph (2).

data.question: True or False: The Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 system can differentiate and identify VOCs via IR spectroscopy.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the significance of the [Au(CN)2]- unit in the structural dimensionality of the Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 system?
data.answer: The [Au(CN)2]- unit increases the structural dimensionality of the system in most cases and likely helps provide stabilization points for the flexible Cu[Au(CN)2]2 framework.

data.question: True or False: The Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 system requires thermal treatment to undergo guest uptake.
data.answer: False

data.question: How does the coordination number and geometry of the copper center influence the color of the Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 complexes?
data.answer: The coordination number (five or six) and specific geometry of the copper center influence the color of the complexes by altering the splitting of the d-orbitals, which shifts the d−d absorption bands.

data.question: True or False: The Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 system is porous.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the role of gold−gold interactions in the Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 system?
data.answer: Gold−gold interactions are present in most of the Cu[Au(CN)2]2(solvent)x complexes and probably help to stabilize the 3-D network as solvent exchange takes place.

data.question: True or False: The Cu[Au(CN)2]2(DMSO)2 system's ability to bind and sense different donor solvents is attributed to its rigid framework.
data.answer: False
